title: Sunday Boredom Busters
text:
October 17,   
Network cable TV's Long Island Medium appears at the Denny Sanford PREMIER Center. Theresa Caputo Live! is at 7 p.m. Tickets are still available at the KELOLAND Box Office starting at $39.75 on up. 
All five community centers in Sioux Falls have Open Gyms today from 1-5 p.m. The open gyms are located at Kenny Anderson, Kuehn, MariCar, Morningside and Oyate Community Centers. 
The Abbey of the Hills Inn & Retreat Center in rural Marvin, SD is hosting a Hymn Festival starting at 3:30 p.m. Abbe7 staff and volunteers will serve a buffet supper afterward. The cost is a free-will donation. 
After finishing raking your yard, bring you leaves to the two city drop-offs in Sioux Falls. They're located at 1015 East Chambers Street, by the Household Hazardous Waste Facility, and at 100 North Lyon Boulevard, west of the fairgrounds. Today's hours are from noon to 5 p.m. The cost is $3 a carload. 
The Dakota Opry is a country music show featuring current songs and classics performed by local artists. The show runs from 4-6 p.m. at the American Legion in Tea, SD. Admission is $5, free for kids 10 and under. 
Find your way through 11 acres of twists and turns at the Heartland Country Corn Maze southeast of Harrisburg on Highway 11. Today's hours are from noon to 5 p.m. Admission is $7, $5 for kids, free for ages 4 and under. 
Films playing at the Wells Fargo CineDome in the Washington Pavilion include Everest, Minions, Deepsea Challenge 3D and Walking With Dinosaurs: Prehistoric Planet. 
New Hollywood releases playing at a theater near you include Goosebumps and Woodland, both rated PG, Bridge of Spies, rated PG-13 and Crimson Peak, rated R. 
It's a double-header of pro football action on KELOLAND-TV. It kicks-off at noon with the Kansas City Chiefs taking on the Minnesota Vikings. That's followed by the San Diego Chargers at Green Bay at 3:30 p.m. Â©
